title: How UConn, South Carolina advanced to the NCAA title game -- and first look at the final
content: South Carolina and UConn advanced to Sunday's NCAA title game. We tracked all the action live from Tampa.

title: Ovechkin scores 894th, draws even with Gretzky
content: Alex Ovechkin tied Wayne Gretzky's NHL goals record by scoring the 894th of his career, setting off a wild celebration in Washington on Friday night. He potentially could have had one more but opted not to try and score on the empty net late.

title: Geno 'humbled' by UConn's record 34-point rout
content: UConn rolled into the national title game with an 85-51 rout of No. 1 overall seed UCLA, recording the largest margin of victory in women's Final Four history.

title: 'A big deal': Pistons climb from worst to playoffs
content: One year after finishing with the worst record in the NBA, the Detroit Pistons are going to the playoffs for the first time since 2018-19 in a historic turnaround.

title: Curry: Dubs 'level up,' playing like title contenders
content: The Warriors won their fifth straight game with Friday's 118-104 victory over the Nuggets, and Stephen Curry said the team is playing with a "sense of urgency down the stretch."

title: S.C. keeps repeat dream alive with rout of Texas
content: After overwhelming Texas 74-57 on Friday in the Final Four of the women's NCAA tournament, South Carolina is just a win away from repeating as national champions for the first time in school history.

title: Sources: Howard to Basketball HOF on 1st ballot
content: Dwight Howard, an eight-time NBA All-Star and three-time Defensive Player of the Year, has been elected to the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame, sources told ESPN.

title: Celtics set NBA's single-season 3-point record
content: The Celtics broke the NBA record for 3-pointers in a season Friday night against the Suns, connecting on their 1,364th to pass the Warriors' mark set in 2022-23.

title: 7-time Pro Bowl receiver Jones officially retires
content: Julio Jones, a 7-time Pro Bowl pick who is the Falcons' all-time leader in receptions and receiving yards, has retired. He last played for the Eagles in 2023.

title: Broome could be 'the most impactful transfer in college basketball history'
content: The SEC Player of the Year is chasing history -- for himself and Auburn -- as the Tigers head into Final Four.

title: Duke's baton now fully passed from Coach K to Jon Scheyer
content: Mike Krzyzewski's emergence from the shadows is the ultimate sign that the baton in Durham has been passed.

title: 'What the heck have we done?' Inside 48 hours of torpedo bat madness
content: From a comment on a Yankees broadcast to a rush of new bat orders, here's how MLB's hottest trend took off.

title: More than the game: Dawn Staley's impact on the places she has called home
content: No matter where she's called home, the Final Four coach's story is held close by those who watched her rise.

title: What's next for UCLA, Texas? Forecasting next season for women's March Madness top seeds
content: From portal priorities to incoming recruits, we look ahead to next season for the Bruins and Longhorns after their Final Four exits.

title: Long snapper rehearses business pitch for Deion Sanders, teammates
content: Camden Dempsey, who launched an insurance company on Thursday, got some extra help in a team meeting.

title: NWSL eyes expansion: Can be 'size of the NFL'
content: National Women's Soccer League commissioner Jessica Berman said Friday that she thinks the league could grow to be the size of the NFL, which has 32 teams.

title: USSF chief backs 48-team Women's WC in 2031
content: U.S. Soccer CEO JT Batson said the federation would strongly support expansion of the Women's World Cup to 48 teams in 2031.

title: Depleted U.S. to experiment in Olympic rematch
content: USWNT coach Emma Hayes said she feels confident in her team's defensive personnel ahead of an Olympic gold medal-game rematch against Brazil, despite the "extremely unfortunate" injury to center-back Tierna Davidson.

title: Amorim: 'Crazy' to believe Man Utd could win Prem
content: Ruben Amorim said he would be "crazy" to think Manchester United can win the Premier League next season.

title: Musiala joins 'crazy' Bayern injury list for Inter QF
content: Jamal Musiala is set to miss the first leg of Bayern Munich's Champions League quarterfinal against Inter Milan on Tuesday, adding to the Bundesliga side's injury woes at a crucial stage of the season.

title: Ronaldo double gives Al Nassr Riyadh derby win
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored twice in the second half, including a penalty, to guide Al-Nassr to a 3-1 win over Al-Hilal in the race for the Saudi Pro League title on Friday.

title: Ancelotti: Olmo clearance doesn't mar LaLiga
content: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti does not believe the decision to allow Barcelona's Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor to continue playing for the club will taint any competition, with his team potentially facing Barça for three trophies.

title: How Nikola Jokic quietly became a defensive analytics darling
content: From kicked ball violations to memorizing plays, Jokic has become one of the league's best defenders.

title: Safety? Aesthetics? Competitive advantage? The real reasons some teams want to ban the tush push
content: It wasn't just about a polarizing on-field rule. It was a window into the back-channel politics of the rules process.

title: 'The most unique quarterback story I've ever heard': How Luis Perez became 'The Spring King'
content: UFL QB Luis Perez has chronicled his unique journey in a book as he pushes for a final chapter in the NFL.

title: UFC Fight Night expert picks, best bets: How Lerone Murphy remains unbeaten
content: Who prevails in this week's UFC Fight Night and PFL First Round? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Why the Manchester derby lost its cachet, and how it might be coming back around
content: Sunday's Manchester derby will be the lowest-key edition in some time. How did we get here, and when might it get back to the thrilling matchup it once was?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gyökeres could be available for £55M
content: Manchester United and Arsenal are eyeing a possible move for Sporting CP's Viktor Gyökeres. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why PM Modi's Grand Welcome In Colombo Is A First For Any Foreign Leader
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was on Saturday accorded a grand ceremonial welcome at the historic Independence Square in the heart of the Sri Lankan capital, in perhaps the first such honour given to a foreign leader.

title: Suspecting Affair, Man Smashes Wife's Head With Hammer In Noida
content: The couple married in 2005 and have two children - a son and a daughter. While their son is an engineering student, their daughter studies in Class 8.

title: Viral Video Shows Woman Thrashing Mother-In-Law, Dragging Her By Hair
content: A video of a woman thrashing her mother-in-law in Madhya Pradesh has gone viral with her husband now fearing for his and his mother's life in light of the grisly Meerut murder.

title: AAP MLA Challenges Waqf Bill In Supreme Court After Congress, A Owaisi
content: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has become the third opposition party after the Congress and Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM to challenge the Waqf Amendment Bill in the Supreme Court as the controversial legislation awaits the President's assent.

title: Days Before 26% Trump Tariff Hits India, A Trade Deal In The Making
content: US President Donald Trump's latest tariff policy has sparked fear among the Indian exporters. But a solution may be around the corner with the Indian and US officials negotiating a trade deal before the tariffs come into force, suggest media reports.

title: "Oops": Trump Shares Video Showing Deadly Strike On Houthis In Yemen
content: Resembling images shot from military drones or other loitering aircraft, the black-and-white footage Trump posted to his Truth Social network shows several dozen human figures from an almost vertical angle.

title: Karnataka Man Was Jailed For Wife's Murder. She Was Then Spotted With Lover
content: In 2022, the police summoned Suresh, claiming his wife's remains had been found near Bettadapura in Periyapatna Taluk.

title: BookMyShow Dropped Kunal Kamra From Artist List, Claims Sena. Comic Reacts
content: Shiv Sena functionary Rahool Kanal on Saturday claimed BookMyShow has taken stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra off the sale and artists list from its platforms.

title: PM Modi In Sri Lanka: Top Honour, Key Defence Pact, And Fishermen Talks
content: The two countries signed a few more pacts, including one to develop Trincomalee as an energy hub. Another agreement was signed to provide India'smulti-sectoral grant assistance to the eastern region of Sri Lanka.

title: Why Americans Are Rushing To Buy Essential Items Ahead Of Trump's Tariffs
content: Donald Trump announced reciprocal tariffs on almost all countries, including the US allies such as the United Kingdom and the European Union.

title: US Moves Largest B-2 Bomber Fleet, 3 Aircraft Carriers To Indo-Pacific
content: While the world was busy figuring out Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff move and its fallout, the United States quietly made a massive military move in the Indian Ocean and Indo-Pacific region.

title: Hardik Breaks Silence On Tilak Retiring Out During MI's Run Chase vs LSG
content: Tilak Varma became just the fourth batter in IPL history to be retired out. In a debatable move, the southpaw walked off the ground to make way for Mitchell Santner.

title: Opinion: Can You Really Trust Trump's 'Magic Potion'?
content: Trump faces a major short-term political challenge: the tariffs are likely to hurt two key constituencies of the GOP - business leaders and working-class MAGA voters.

title: Meghalaya 10th Board Result 2025 Out, Massive 31% Jump In Pass Percentage
content: MBOSE SSLC Result 2025 Out: Out of 63,682 students who appeared for the exam, 55,473 have passed, recording a pass percentage of 87.10%, a substantial rise from last year's pass percentage of 55.80%.

title: Trump-Freed Drug Convict Arrested Again For Assaulting 3-Year-Old
content: Jonathan Braun, 41, from Nassau County, has been accused of punching a man during a dinner at his home. After arguing with the man, he shoved his three-year-old child to the ground, according to the complaint.

title: Cash row: Justice Varma takes oath as Allahabad HC judge, but won't get work
content: Justice Yashwant Varma took oath as a judge of Allahabad high court despite an ongoing in-house inquiry over semi-burnt cash recovered from his residence. There's no judicial work assigned for now. A PIL was filed to halt the ceremony, and the legal fraternity criticized the decision, urging the Chief Justice to reconsider until the investigation concludes.

title: Delhi govt rolls out Centre's Ayushman Bharat scheme
content: Delhi's BJP-led administration has partnered with the central government to adopt the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana. The healthcare scheme will provide eligible Delhi households with annual health insurance worth Rs 10 lakh. This makes Delhi the 35th state/Union Territory to implement this health programme.

title: 'It's fine': Kamra reacts to Shiv Sena's 'BookMyShow removed him' claim
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra queries BookMyShow about his removal from their list of artists following controversial remarks against Maharashtra deputy CM Eknath Shinde. This comes after Shiv Sena's Rahool Kanal thanked BookMyShow for removing Kamra, highlighting the conflict where Shiv Sainiks vandalized Kamra's performance studio.

title: Elon Musk believes the 'biggest threat’ to US citizens is…
content: Elon Musk highlighted concerns over US government debt, backing author Scott Adams' view on rising dangers. Musk, leading DOGE to reduce federal spending waste, faces political resistance. Reports suggest Trump hints at Musk's exit from the role were refuted by Musk as 'fake news'.

title: 'BJP wants to divide country': Tejashwi Yadav slams Waqf Bill as 'unconstitutional'
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav condemned the Waqf Amendment Bill, 2025, as unconstitutional, accusing BJP of promoting division and distracting from key issues. The Bill, which passed Parliament, aims to enhance transparency and governance of Waqf institutions while cutting mandatory contributions and ensuring women's inheritance.

title: Axar Patel drops big-hitting star for CSK clash — Here's why
content: Delhi Capitals will play without vice-captain Faf du Plessis in their crucial match against Chennai Super Kings due to fitness issues. Despite this, captain Axar Patel won the toss and chose to bat first as DC looks to continue its winning momentum, while CSK aims to recover from recent defeats.

title: Microsoft VP tells Google employees: Don't come to me for jobs, go to…
content: Microsoft AI VP Nando de Freitas acknowledged Google's DeepMind for its new AI models while addressing restrictive employment contracts at DeepMind. He received multiple requests for help from distressed DeepMind employees regarding notice periods and noncompete agreements but directed them to internal leadership instead.

title: Cab driver helps woman deliver baby in Gurugram, hailed online as 'real Vikas'
content: In Gurugram, a Rapido driver named Vikas assisted in the delivery of a baby inside his cab, ensuring both mother and newborn's safety. He then drove them to the hospital and only charged the standard fare. His kindness was shared on Reddit, with users urging recognition and appreciation for his selfless act.

title: 'Unfortunate what happened ...': MI coach shares details of Rohit's injury
content: Mumbai Indians' head coach Mahela Jayawardene confirmed star opener Rohit Sharma missed the IPL 2025 match against Lucknow due to a knee injury from practice. Rohit’s inability to bat without discomfort led to the decision to rest him. His absence pressures the team as they seek to recover in a critical tournament phase.

title: Lights out! Pak vs NZ observes bizarre power cut - Watch
content: During the final ODI between Pakistan and New Zealand at Bay Oval, a bizarre floodlight failure occurred mid-delivery, causing temporary confusion. Pakistan was chasing 265 but faltered, ending at 221, with key performances from Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Despite initial solid efforts, Pakistan's middle and lower order collapsed, marking a tough tour overall.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman has defended the intense work ethic required for startup success, emphasizing that employees needed to continue working after family dinners during the company's early days. Hoffman argues that work-life balance is not feasible in startups, highlighting the significant rewards for those who embrace the demanding culture.

title: Jobless after Supreme Court verdict, Bengal teacher attempts suicide
content: A teacher in Canning, who lost her job post-Supreme Court SSC verdict, attempted suicide due to financial strain and personal issues. She consumed sleeping pills and is now in intensive care. The teacher's note revealed struggles with debt and family abandonment, adding to her distress. Many families impacted by the verdict may face similar financial pressures.

title: 'It's gone': Conservation science in Thailand's burning forest
content: Scientist Inna Birchenko began to cry as she described the smouldering protected forest in Thailand where she was collecting samples from local trees shrouded in wildfire smoke. Birchenko and her colleagues hiked kilometre after kilometre through burned or still-smouldering forest, each footstep stirring up columns of black and grey ash.

title: Ruturaj Gaikwad recovers from elbow injury, no Dhoni as captain
content: Fans at MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai were anticipating Mahendra Singh Dhoni to lead the toss but were met with Ruturaj Gaikwad instead. Dhoni, also known as 'Thala', has passed the captaincy baton to Gaikwad for Chennai Super Kings' IPL 2024 season. CSK’s IPL triumphs under Dhoni came in 2010, 2011, 2018, 2021, and 2023.

title: ED seizes Rs 1.5 crore in FEMA case linked to 'Empuraan' producer
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted a multi-state search operation on Friday, recovering Rs 1.5 crore in Tamil Nadu and Kerala. The operation is part of an investigation into suspected violations of the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) by Gokulam Gopalan's Sree Gopalan Chit and Finance Co. Ltd.

title: 'CT, NZ series loss in past; Pakistan will now enjoy PSL': Rizwan
content: After suffering a 3-0 series defeat to New Zealand, Mohammad Rizwan urges Pakistan to focus on the upcoming Pakistan Super League (PSL). Despite individual flashes of form from Babar Azam and Naseem Shah, Pakistan's batting struggled against New Zealand's strong attack. Rizwan remains optimistic, emphasizing PSL as an opportunity for Pakistan to regain confidence.

title: Tech entrepreneurs hit back at Goyal's remark on startups
content: Zepto's CEO Aadit Palicha defended the quick commerce sector against Union Minister Piyush Goyal's critique, emphasizing its economic contribution. Goyal urged startups to focus on high-tech fields. Ashneer Grover and TV Mohandas Pai also criticized the government's approach, highlighting the need for capital and investor support for deep-tech growth.

title: JP Morgan predicts US recession by 2025-end due to Trump tariffs
content: J P Morgan projects a US recession by the end of 2025, attributing it to President Trump's new reciprocal tariffs. The forecast indicates a potential GDP decline and higher unemployment. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell echoed the concerns, highlighting that tariffs may cause higher inflation and slower growth.

title: Pregnant woman dies after Pune hospital demands Rs 10L advance, sparks statewide protests
content: Political parties protested outside Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital in Pune after a pregnant woman died, alleging she was denied treatment due to inability to pay an advance. The state government has initiated a high-level inquiry, promising strict action if the hospital is found at fault.

title: Now, watchman gets Rs 2.2 crore I-T notice in Aligarh; 4th case in 2 wks
content: Rajkumar Singh, a 45-year-old watchman in Aligarh, has received a notice to pay Rs 2.2 crore in taxes due to the fraudulent use of his PAN card for large transactions. This incident follows similar cases affecting people from low-income backgrounds, prompting an ongoing investigation by the Income Tax department.

title: Protests force Telangana govt to junk infotech park for eco park
content: The Telangana government plans to shift University of Hyderabad to Future City and transform the 2,000 acres, including its campus, into a vast eco park after recent protests and a Supreme Court intervention. The proposed eco park aims to become a leading environmental tourism destination with comprehensive green and wildlife conservation initiatives.

title: Watch: Imam-ul-Haq suffers a gruesome blow on jaw in New Zealand
content: Imam-ul-Haq was stretchered off after being struck on the jaw by a powerful throw during Pakistan's final ODI against New Zealand. He was diagnosed with a concussion and replaced by Usman Khan. Despite the injury, New Zealand's Ben Sears led his team to a 43-run victory, securing a series sweep.

title: After Owaisi, AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan challenges Waqf Bill in SC
content: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan has approached the Supreme Court challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Bill 2025, claiming it limits religious and cultural autonomy of Muslims. Despite criticism from the INDIA bloc, the bill, aiming for secular and transparent Waqf administration, was passed by Parliament with significant majorities in both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha.

title: Bengaluru suitcase murder: How a Marathi song led to techie killing his wife
content: In Bengaluru, Rakesh Khedekar confessed to killing his wife, Gouri Sambrekar, over ongoing insults towards his family. After a heated argument fueled by alcohol, he stabbed her multiple times in rage. He attempted to hide her body in a suitcase but fled when the plan failed. Rakesh was arrested in Shirwal, Maharashtra.

title: PM Modi in Sri Lanka: India, SL sign 7 pacts; defence, energy in focus
content: Prime Minister Modi’s three-day visit to Sri Lanka fostered stronger bilateral ties with President Dissanayake. Seven MoUs were signed in key sectors including defence, energy, and trade. Modi received the Mithra Vibhushana medal, highlighting his role in regional cooperation and India’s support during Sri Lanka’s economic crisis.

title: Why Tilak Varma was retired out by Mumbai Indians
content: Mumbai Indians retired out Tilak Varma during their IPL-2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a finger injury which hampered his ability to hit powerfully. Coach Mahela Jayawardene deemed the tactical decision necessary, but MI eventually fell short of their 204-run chase. TOI has learnt that the decision, which seems harsh on the face of it on the talented batter, was purely taken as Tilak is suffering from a niggle in a finger.

title: Himachal Pradesh hills feel the heat as maximum temp hits 'sizzling 30s'
content: Himachal Pradesh has experienced a rise in both maximum and minimum temperatures over the past week, with several areas recording temperatures well above normal. The IMD has predicted a hot summer with increased heatwave days and expects deficient rainfall. Kullu received the highest rain, while Una recorded the lowest.

title: SC fines Agra farmhouse Rs 17L for felling 17 trees
content: The Supreme Court has fined the owners of a farmhouse in Agra's Dayalbagh Rs 17 lakh for illegally cutting down 17 trees in the eco-sensitive Taj Trapezium Zone. The court also directed them to allocate 0.3 hectares of land for the forest department to plant 340 new trees and maintain them for 10 years.

title: ‘Break up with boyfriend? Come with us’: North eastern woman molested in Bengaluru
content: A 24-year-old woman from Assam was sexually harassed by two scooter-borne men in Bengaluru while returning home in the early hours. The men repeatedly touched her inappropriately and solicited favors. Hotel staff intervened, and police are now investigating the incident, having registered a case and collected CCTV footage.

title: ‘Quarrel over breakfast with husband’: Noida woman kills two kids, dies by suicide
content: A 35-year-old woman and her two children, aged 6 and 5, were found dead on their house roof in Bisrakh. Police suspect she hanged herself after killing the children following a quarrel with her husband, Rajkumar. The couple, who had been married for 12 years, often fought over domestic issues. The bodies have been sent for autopsy.

title: IPL: Rathi fined again for celebrations; Pant penalised for slow over-rate
content: Lucknow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Singh Rathi has been fined 50 per cent of his match fee for violating the IPL code of conduct during their win over Mumbai Indians. This is his second penalty for the same offense. Additionally, LSG captain Rishabh Pant was fined ₹12 lakh for maintaining a slow over-rate in the match.

title: Karnataka man spends 1.5 years in jail for wife’s ‘murder’, she walks into court alive
content: In a surprising turn of events, a man accused of murdering his wife was relieved when she was found alive and presented in court. The court has summoned police officers who investigated the case and arranged protection for her while examining her as an additional witness.

title: Tensions in Manipur: Women protestors try to storm NPP chief's home
content: Tensions escalated in Imphal West as women protesters attempted to storm NPP state president Yumnam Joykumar Singh's residence over his controversial remarks. Singh's statement accusing Arambai Tenggol of attacking Kukis was retracted, and the NPP youth wing called it a misunderstanding, vowing to prevent such issues in the future.

title: Sift Kaur Samra wins gold medal at ISSF World Cup in Buenos Aires
content: Indian shooter Sift Kaur Samra claimed her first individual ISSF World Cup gold in the women's 50m rifle 3 positions in Buenos Aires. Despite a slow start, she made a stunning comeback and finished with 458.6 points. India now stand second in the season-opening World Cup with one gold and one bronze.

title: 5 netas quit JDU in Bihar, which will go to polls later this year
content: Three Muslim JDU functionaries resigned over the party's support for the waqf bill in Bihar, raising concerns ahead of state elections. Despite the backlash, JDU believes welfare initiatives for minorities will secure votes. JDU has faced strained relations with Muslim voters after past support for controversial bills, but remains optimistic about its electoral prospects.

title: Birmingham streets full of garbage, pests, and stink as workers strike drags on
content: Birmingham faces 17,000 tonnes of uncollected rubbish due to a municipal workers' strike, which escalated from limited action in January to an indefinite strike. The dispute involves pay cuts affecting up to 150 workers by £8,000 annually. Overflowing bins and pests pose public health risks, drawing comparisons to the 1978 garbage strike.

title: Russian strike kills 18, including 9 children, in Zelenskyy's hometown
content: A Russian missile strike on the residential area of Kryvyi Rih killed 18 people, including nine children, and wounded over two dozen others. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy accuses Russia of deliberate attacks and neglecting ceasefire agreements. Russia confirmed the strike, claiming it targeted a restaurant where commanders and Western instructors were meeting.

title: ‘Why no egg with midday meal ?’: TN schoolboy asks cook, gets thrashed with broom
content: A primary school cook in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai district was suspended and arrested for beating a Class V student with a broomstick after he questioned why he wasn't served an egg. The incident, recorded by another student, led to suspensions, arrests, and the transfer of the responsible teacher, Flora.

title: Agusta accused claims bid to poison him in Tihar jail
content: A Delhi court has requested a status report from Tihar Jail following allegations by Christian Michel James, suspected middleman in the AgustaWestland case, that attempts were made to poison him in prison. James, requesting enhanced security, claimed previous poisoning attempts in 2019. The court also ordered his medical examination at AIIMS Delhi to alleviate his post-surgery pain.

title: Manoj Kumar: Man who made ‘Bharat’ a screen hero
content: Manoj Kumar, known for his patriotic roles in films like 'Upkar' and 'Kranti', passed away at 87 after battling health issues. Kumar's career included celebrated works in both nationalistic and crime dramas. His death was widely mourned, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledging his significant contribution to Indian cinema.

title: Karnataka 2nd PUC result 2025 on karresults.nic.in: When and how to check
content: The Karnataka 2nd PUC Result 2025 is expected to be announced in April. Students can check their results online via the official websites, karresults.nic.in and kseab.karnataka.gov.in/english. The result will be provisional, and the original mark sheet will be provided by schools. Following past trends, the results are typically declared in April, with the announcement expected around mid-month. Students should stay updated on the official websites for further details.

title: Adani group firm buys 1-acre SoBo wooded plot for Rs 170 crore
content: A prime piece of land on Carmichael Road in south Mumbai has been sold to Mah-Hill Properties, an Adani Group subsidiary, for Rs 170 crore. Originally intended for a children's park, the plot is now designated for residential purposes. The deal involves Behram Nowrosji Gamadia, who inherited the property, and Mah-Hill Properties, with the transaction finalizing in late March.

title: De Bruyne to leave Man City at end of season
content: Kevin De Bruyne has announced that he will leave the club at the end of the season . the england international's contract at the Etihad Stadium expires in the summer . he said on friday that the club will leave as a free agent .

title: Jets take over the top spot, plus every team's performance vs. projections
content: the blues beat the Penguins for their 11th win in a row . there are less than two weeks left in the 2024-25 NHL regular season . the playoff field continues to be whittled down, with teams clinching berths .

title: Your guide to the men's Final Four: Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston (with picks!)
content: a showdown of the top two teams from the best conference in men's college basketball . our experts are here to break down how each team can win its final four matchup . read their analysis for Florida vs. Auburn .

title: Harry Kane is on a mission to finally end his long personal trophy drought
content: despite winning trophies and featuring in five finals, Harry Kane has never won a major club trophy . the 33-time german league champion has never tasted victory in a competition . he says he is a man on a mission to win silverware of note . his first year with Bayern Munich ended trophy-less, an unusual feat .

title: Trump 'actively negotiating' trade deal with India before tariffs hit: Report
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Shield of a true friend': PM hails Colombo's vow to India over territory
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Job loss for 25,752 teachers- Mamata and Bengal's moment of reckoning
content: University of Hyderabad forest cover: 10 species that could have become homeless Explore Priyanka Chopra’s newest sky-high beauty guide 10 carnivorous plants that feed on living creatures 8 best weekend getaways near Delhi for a quick escape Pooja Hegde Embraces the Allure of Regal Bold Glamour ​8 lesser known reasons to add curd to the daily diet ​ From ethereal to bold: Rashmika Mandanna’s saree styles steal thespotlight 10 tips to raise a child who remains positive in every situation Trisha Krishnan redefines power dressing in a stunning burgundy pantsuit

title: Government holds meeting with Meitei-Kuki groups on Manipur conflict resolution
content: Central Government mediates peace talks between Meitei and Kuki communities in Manipur to restore normalcy after ethnic violence

title: Central Government approves ₹1280 crore to Bihar, Himachal, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry as disaster assistance
content: An official statement said that out of the total amount, ₹588.73 crore has been approved for Bihar, ₹136.22 crore for Himachal Pradesh, ₹522.34 crore for Tamil Nadu and ₹33.06 crore for Puducherry

title: Maintain status quo: SC on demolition of 'unauthorised' constructions in Gurugram's DLF phases
content: A bench of Justices J.K. Maheshwari and Aravind Kumar was hearing a plea by DLF Qutub Enclave RWA, which challenged the Haryana government's Town and Country Planning Department's power to raze the properties.

title: Officials of KBJNL discharge water from Basavasagar reservoir to canals in Yadgir district of Karnataka
content: When officials stopped release of water on March 25, farmers, pro-Kannada groups, Dalit organisations and BJP activists led by former MLA Narasimha Nayak held a series of protests

title: American citizen among two arrested for drug trade in Hyderabad
content: Now residing in Begumpet and working for a Hyderabad-based firm, Katta along with his associate allegedly made regular trips to Mumbai every fortnight to procure narcotics

title: RSS mouthpiece pulls down article on comparison of land owned by Catholic churches, Waqf Board after Rahul Gandhi questioned its motive
content: The article by the RSS mouthpiece claimed Catholic churches owned more land than waqf board in India which the LoP says is next step to target another community after Muslims

title: Traders cautioned against imposters collecting licence fees
content: Traders have been receiving phone calls asking them to pay the trade licence fee to online accounts,  Commissioner Kurnool Municipal Corporation said

title: Radhotsavam performed at Srisailam
content: As part of Arudrotsavams, the temple priests performed Mahanyasapurvaka Ekadasa Rudrabhisekham, Annabhisekham and other special pujas to Lord Mallikarjunaswamy

title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan moves SC against Waqf Bill
content: Mr. Khan sought that the Waqf (Amendment) Bill be declared as "unconstitutional and being violative of Articles 14, 15, 21, 25, 26, 29, 30 and 300-A of the Constitution" and sought direction for striking it down

title: What are Americans buying before Trump's tariffs kick in? Full list
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: ED seizes ₹1.5 crore, documents in ‘FEMA violation’ during raids at Empuraan producer Gokulam Gopalan’s premises
content: ED says searches were conducted based on specific intelligence that Gokulam Gopalan’s company was collecting subscriptions to chit funds from people outside India ‘without due permission from competent authority’

title: 5 killed, 11 pilgrims injured after mini-bus rams into parked truck in Karnataka
content: The passengers of the mini-bus, all residents of Bagalkot, were en route a dargah in Kalaburagi district when the accident occurred around 3.30 a.m.

title: Cordon and search operation conducted in Kurnool city
content: Searches were conducted in the residences of history-sheeters and trouble mongers and a foot patrol was conducted in the colony, police officials said

title: Stock market slump: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav says common people losing money; blames Centre
content: In a post on X, the former Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh held the Central Government responsible for this "double vicious circle" of the economy

title: Waqf Bill: BJP sought support, but we didn’t agree, claims Shiv Sena (UBT)‘s Raut
content: "Till the last minute, senior BJP leaders from Maharashtra and Delhi were in touch (on Waqf Bill) with Shiv Sena (UBT), claims, Sanjay Raut

title: Explore partnerships with research labs for country’s accelerated economic development: former ISRO head to business managers
content: Addressing graduation ceremony at ISB, he calls for measures to increase India’s share in the $500 billion global space economy from 2% to atleast 10%

title: Kerala govt can solve Munambam land dispute ‘in 10 minutes’, says V.D. Satheesan
content: Kerala Opposition Leader says Munambam land dispute and amendment to Waqf Act are not connected but ‘some people with vested interests are trying to link the two issues’

title: Telangana | Resolution passed to revamp Undergraduate curriculum from 2025-26
content: Emerging areas such as Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity, Fintech, and Research Aptitude to be included in the revamp

title: Over 3,000 cases booked against children abandoning aged parents in Karnataka since 2007
content: Medical college hospitals have been told to file cases under senior citizens’ law against children who admit their parents but do not return: Dr. Sharan Prakash Patil

title: Rajnath Singh inaugurates infra projects at Karwar naval base
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh flags off Indian Ocean Ship SAGAR from Karwar naval base, reinforcing maritime security

title: Heatwave likely in Northwest India over next six days; temperature may soar to 42 degree Celsius in Delhi
content: Regions likely to be impacted include south Haryana, Delhi, west Uttar Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Punjab, Gujarat, Rajasthan and west Madhya Pradesh

title: Noida m an kills wife with hammer over suspicion of affair
content: Asma (42) worked as a software engineer in Noida while her husband Nurullah Haider was jobless, police said

title: 14 Tamil Nadu districts to get special courts to hear POCSO Act cases
content: The Special Courts, in the cadre of a District Judge, will be set up in the 14 districts in three phases, said Law Minister S. Regupathy

title: SC verdict: Judge-turned-MP suggests forming panel to segregate deserving and dishonest candidates
content: Former judge urges CM Banerjee to form committee to review invalidated teacher appointments in West Bengal

title: Modi in Colombo: PM Modi accorded grand ceremonial welcome at  Independence Square
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi receives grand ceremonial welcome in Sri Lanka, discussing defense cooperation and economic assistance.

title: Indian FTOs urge Odisha Government to relax ₹100 crore turnover condition to bid for running Biju Patnaik Aviation Centre
content: The Indian FTOs pointed out that none of them could qualify for the bid as all domestic FTOs suffered huge financial losses during the COVID-19 pandemic

title: Dust storm in Thane damages building; residents evacuated
content: Strong winds reportedly caused cracks in the walls of two terrace-level rooms in an unauthorised seven-storey structure in Thakur Pada.

title: Indian national stabbed to death in Canada; one suspect taken in custody
content: The High Commission of India in Ottawa, the capital of Canada, said the incident happened in Rockland. It did not identify the victim.

title: PM Modi says Cabinet nod for Railway projects will improve connectivity infrastructure
content: PM Modi was reacting to the Union Cabinet’s approval for four projects of the Ministry of Railways involving a total cost of about ₹18,658 crore.

title: Bengali travellers seem to be moving away from Darjeeling and Sikkim to Kashmir
content: ‘Compared to Darjeeling and Sikkim, Kashmir offers better value for money in terms of hotels, food, and experiences in addition to political stability,’ they say

title: PM Modi in Sri Lanka Updates: India, Sri Lanka ink defence partnership pact following talks
content: PM Modi conferred Mithra Vibhushana award by President Dissanayake.; Sri Lanka will not allow its territory to be used in manner inimical to India’s security interests, President Dissanayake assures PM Modi

title: Pressure by Indian authorities got Virgin Atlantic to fly stranded passengers to Mumbai: AAP leader
content: AAP Mumbai president Preeti Sharma Menon, whose relatives were on the flight, said the airline abandoned the 270 passengers at the remote military Diyarbakir Airport, and the local staff had no resources to manage them despite trying their best.

title: Trek to Srisailam Temple: A gruelling journey and a tale of unwavering devotion
content: Every year thousands of pilgrims from Karnataka and Maharashtra trek to Srisailam Temple for Ugadi Brahmotsavams; in their demanding journey, resolute devotion is their guiding light

title: BSF foils infiltration bid; Pakistan intruder shot dead along international border in Jammu
content: BSF foils Pakistani infiltration attempt, intruder shot dead at Jammu International Border, investigation underway, strong protest lodged with Pakistan.

title: Unfortunate that the BJP wants to politicise office of Lok Sabha Speaker, says Congress’s Venugopal
content: Congress general secretary (organisation) and Public Accounts Committee (PAC) Chairman K C Venugopal speaks with The Hindu on the key takeaways

title: CPI(M) exhibition highlights stories of two women Communist trailblazers
content: While Pathaiyil Pathintha Adikal, a biographical novel by Sahitya Akademi winner Rajam Krishnan, captures the life and struggles of Manalur Maniammal, Mella Kanavai Pazhakathaiyai is an autobiographical novel by Pa. Visalam

title: Farmers to ‘greet’ Eknath Shinde with Kumal Kamra’s parody song as they oppose Nagpur-Goa highway
content: Farmers have accused the Mahayuti government of going back on its promise made during the Assembly poll last year of scrapping the project and providing loan waivers to farmers.

title: Protests at Pune hospital over death of pregnant woman ‘denied’ admission
content: Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis ordered a high-level inquiry to be headed by the Pune-based Joint Charity Commissioner.

title: CBI facilitates return of two fugitives from UAE
content: The agency’s International Police Cooperation Unit worked in collaboration with Interpol’s National Central Bureau in Abu Dhabi and the respective State police forces to secure the returns.

title: Sambhal riot: Court rejects bail plea of accused
content: According to Public Prosecutor, “there are serious allegations against Shahi Jama Masjid management committee president Zafar Allike assembling a crowd, pelting stones on police, fabricating facts

title: Companies defend India’s startup proposition after Piyush Goyal’s jibe stirs debate
content: Indian entrepreneurs unite to defend startup ecosystem against criticism, emphasizing the need for local champions and innovation support.

title: Supreme Court orders mandatory disclosure of criminal history in bail petitions
content: The bench's order said if the disclosure was found to be incorrect subsequently, it would be grounds to dismiss the special leave petition.

title: CAT dismisses IAS officer plea for allocation to Telangana
content: The Central Administrative Tribunal-Hyderaad dismissed the petition filed by senior IAS officer A. Vani Prasad seeking a direction to allot her to Telangana cadre

title: Gujarat firecracker factory blaze: Smoke, and a mirror to society
content: The Banaskantha firecracker factory blaze in Gujarat killed 21 people out of the 24 in the building, among them eight children. While the State and Central governments responded quickly with an announcement of aid and the arrest of the owners, the factory was operating without a licence to manufacture. Abhinay Lakshman finds that the families were all migrants from Madhya Pradesh

title: ICMR team blames bird flu and other factors for Narasaraopet girl’s death
content: Consuming undercooked meat, poor immunity and unhygienic living conditions have been identified as the other causes for the death, the team members say

title: West Bengal teachers’ appointment cancellation: WBSSC says cannot complete recruitment in three months
content: West Bengal School Service Commission (WBSSC) chairperson Siddhartha Majumdar told journalists that the commission would seek legal advice on who can take the fresh tests

title: Students get tips on transforming innovative ideas into business at ‘Udyavishk-2K25’
content: 10-day workshop on ‘Student Innovation and Entrepreneurship’ begins at PVP Siddhartha Institute of Technology in Vijayawada

title: Hyderabad gears up for Ram Navami Shobha Yatra amid tight security
content: In anticipation of the large-scale participation, Hyderabad Police are taking extensive security measures

title: Pregnant Pune woman dies after ‘treatment denied’, CM orders inquiry
content: On March 31, Tanisha seven-months pregnant with twins and wife of the personal secretary of a BJP MLC, Amit Gorkhe, died after the Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital, a charitable trust hospital, allegedly refused emergency treatment, demanding ₹20 lakh per baby for admission.

title: Matrilineal Meghalaya attracting more girls to IIM-Shillong
content: The institute, fifth among 20 IIMs in India in terms of graduation outcome, has maintained its 100% placement record

title: Congress’s Hooda flays Haryana BJP over hike in electricity rates
content: The BJP government increasing the electricity rates has exposed the party’s anti-people stance, alleges Mr. Hooda

title: Hoteliers thank government for reducing bar license fees in Andhra Pradesh
content: Members of Andhra Pradesh Hotels Association have expressed their gratitude to the government for heeding their plea and reducing the bar license fees for three-star and above hotels to ₹25 lakh from ₹66 lakh.

title: Sharmila demands White Paper on height of Polavaram project
content: Addressing the media here, Ms. Sharmila said the full storage capacity of the project was reduced from 45 metres to 41 metres, reducing what had been designed to be the lifeline of Andhra Pradesh into a barrage

title: Muslim-majority village in Haryana elects Hindu woman as sarpanch
content: Election will send message of communal harmony across the region, says new chief of Siroli panchayat in Haryana’s Nuh

title: AIMPLB seeks appointment with president to express concern over Waqf Bill passed by Parliament
content: The Board has requested the President that "given the gravity of the matter", she grant it an early appointment convenient so that it may present its concerns and discuss possible resolutions within the Constitutional framework.

title: Sickle Cell Anaemia prevalence could be higher in the country, says CCMB scientist
content: A National Sickle Cell Anaemia Elimination Mission was launched in July 2023 to eliminate the disease by 2047 by aiming to screen 7 crore people below the age of 40 years in high prevalence tribal areas

title: Renovation of bonsai garden in Lalbagh to be completed by March 2026
content: In January, 2025, after the completion of the first phase of renovation at a cost of ₹50 lakh - ₹60 lakh, the garden was opened to the public in its revamped form.

title: Spotted deer killed in canine attack, another strays into residential locality in Serlingampally
content: UoH students allege that the spotted deer lost their hideout due to clearance of greenery in 100 acres of Kancha Gachibowli, and hence are more vulnerable to canine attacks

title: PSLV Orbital Experimental Module makes atmospheric re-entry: ISRO
content: On December 30, 2024, ISRO’s PSLV-C60 launched twin SPADEX satellites, and after injecting the satellites at 475 km altitude, the specially configured upper stage (PS4) of PSLV-C60 (called PSLV Orbital Experimental Module in short POEM-4) was also almost in the same orbit.

title: CCMB’s sickle cell anaemia toolkit rolls out in tribal heartland of Jharkhand
content: The pilot project is being taken up in three districts of East and West Singhbhum and Seraikela-Kharsawan districts where about two lakh people from among the vulnerable tribal groups will be screened

title: Modified multi-visceral transplant done to treat intestinal disorder at private hospital in Chennai
content: MGM Healthcare successfully performed the procedure, saving the life of a 32-year-old patient from Kerala

title: LDF, UDF criticise ED searches on Gokulam Gopalan
content: Attacks on L2: Empuraan amounted to a forced intervention in Kerala’s cultural sphere, says T.P. Ramakrishnan

title: IPL Live: Suspense Ends Over Dhoni Replacing Gaikwad As Captain, DC Bat vs CSK
content:
Chennai Super Kings vs Delhi Capitals LIVE Updates:  After scoring his fifty in 33 balls, KL Rahul has put his foot on the accelerator pedal. Sameer Rizvi, on the other hand, is also playing a fiery knock as three-down DC are cruising vs CSK in their IPL 2025 game in Chennai. Abhishek Porel scored 33 off 20 while Axar Patel slammed 21 off 14. Earlier, Delhi Capitals (DC) skipper Axar Patel won the toss and opted to bat. Ahead of the toss, there were speculations that veteran MS Dhoni will be leading CSK in the game as their regular skipper sustained an injury in the previous game. However, the rumours were dismissed at the toss as Gaikwad came in to lead. DC have named Sameer Rizvi in the Playing XI, who replaced an injured Faf du Plessis. On the other hand, CSK named Devon Conway in the place of Jamie Overton and Mukesh Chaudhary in place of Rahul Tripathi. ( Live Scorecard )
